Topic.Title: Is it time to buy KO

Message.Msg: Might as well wait for the 200 DMA test now...

Worked for Coke before Roberto C. Goizueta, died and the stock topped $85/share. It split 3 times when Goizueta was running Coke. Dropped like a rock when he died and the shares that just split are the same ones that sold for $85 in July of 1998. KO is a great company but it isn't magic. Stock price is directly linked to consumer sentiment (emotion). Those of us that held shares in 1998 have waited for 14 years to get close to those valuations.

Topic.Title: Obama EPA to force 100 power plants to close

Message.Msg: And your facts are? Can you tell me when and where President Obama said either of the phrases you've attributed to him? Didn't think so, because he didn't say them. By the way, the word you were apparently after (although I don't know why) is spelled b-a-r-r-i-c-a-d-e-s. Also by the way, I favor cleaner energy (less coal, etc.) even though utilities that currently use a lot of coal are major parts of my portfolio. As a colleague of mine once said, "It doesn't matter what your portfolio's worth if you can't breathe the air."

Message.Title: when will this consolidation done?
Message.Msg: down for the whole month of august...just wondering how long i should wait to buy...i am thinking anytime under $37, or should i wait all the way to $36 (around the 200 MA) or even $35.5, i am sure there will be a pull back of the general markets after the hugh 6 weeks run. anyone care to say something or provide some thoughts would be appreciated.

Technically speaking this is a good entry spot. Going by past history of the MACD and Slow Stochastic it should make a turn in the next week or so. I bought Oct $26 calls. Can't wait for them to make a run.
i am looking to short some Oct puts...should i short the 40 or 37.5...any comments???
I added more to my position today. I felt this was a decent entry point based off some analysis I did. Sure, may pull back further but I was ok with around today's price.
